article.title: Spectral properties of Ruelle transfer operators for regular Gibbs measures and decay of correlations for contact Anosov flows

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula `(Lfh)(x) =  ∑_(σ(y)=x) e^(f(y))h(y)` define?
In the context of the formula `|∆(expu_z (u), exp_z^s (v)) − dω_z(u, v)| ≤ C_0 ((u^2 v^ϑ + u^ϑ v^2))`, what does \'∆\' represent?
What does the symbol \'ζ(s)\' represent in this formula: `ζ(s) =  ∏_γ (1 − e^(−sℓ(γ)))^(−1) ,  s ∈ C`?
What does the term \' |h|_θ \' represent in this formula: `|h|_θ = sup (|h(x) − h(y)|)/(D_θ(x, y)) :  x ≠ y ,  x, y ∈ U  < ∞`?
choices: The Hölder exponent of function h
The Lipschitz constant of function h with respect to the metric D_θ
The topological pressure of function h
The spectral radius of the Ruelle transfer operator
